Package com.atakmap.android.util

Class ATAKUtilities

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.atakmap.android.util.ATAKUtilities
  • public class ATAKUtilities
extends java.lang.Object
    Home for utility functions that don't have a better home yet. Should consolidate functions like findSelf that otherwise will be copy-pasted 20 times.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class Description
      static interface  ATAKUtilities.BitmapDecoder
      Allow for application registration of decoders.

      • getDefaultSymbologyProvider

        public static ISymbologyProvider getDefaultSymbologyProvider()
        Returns the default symbology provider. This provider should be used for flows where the symbology provider may not be implicitly derived based on the symbol code or where the user otherwise is not able to select a provider.
        Returns:
        the default symbology provider at this time.

      • scaleToFit

        public static void scaleToFit​(MapView _mapView,
                              MapItem item,
                              boolean includeSelf,
                              int widthPad,
                              int heightPad)
        Scales map to fit item and, if includeself is true, the self marker, within a space width by height around the focus point.
        Parameters:
        _mapView - the mapview to use when scaling to fit around the item.
        item - the item to use
        includeSelf - if the scaleToFit should also make use of the self marker
        widthPad - the padding to be used for the width around the best fit.
        heightPad - the padding to be used for the height of the bet fit.

                              int widthPad,
                              int heightPad)

        Parameters:

        items - the array of items to provide a best fit for
        widthPad - the padding to be used for the width around the best fit.
        heightPad - the padding to be used for the height of the bet fit.

      • scaleToFit

        public static boolean scaleToFit​(MapView mv,
                                 GeoPoint[] points,
                                 double altitude,
                                 int widthPad,
                                 int heightPad)
        Scales map to fit item and, if includeself is true, the self marker, within a space width by height around the focus point.
        Parameters:
        mv - the mapview to use when scaling to fit.
        points - the array of geopoints to use
        altitude - Altitude to zoom to (perspective mode only; NaN to ignore)
        widthPad - the padding to be used for the width around the best fit.
        heightPad - the padding to be used for the height of the bet fit.
        Returns:
        true if the scale process was successful.

      • scaleToFit

        public static boolean scaleToFit​(MapView mv,
                                 GeoBounds bounds,
                                 double altitude,
                                 int widthPad,
                                 int heightPad)
        Given a bounds and an altitude scale the current map view to fit with some padding.
        Parameters:
        mv - the map view
        bounds - the bounds
        altitude - the altitude and if the altitude is unknown should be Double.NaN
        widthPad - the padding width of the bounds visually in pixels
        heightPad - the padding height of the bounds visually in pixels
        Returns:
        true if it is successful

      • getMaximumFocusResolution

        public static double getMaximumFocusResolution​(GeoPoint location,
                                               double localElevation,
                                               double vfov,
                                               int heightPx)
        Computes the maximum GSD that should be specified when focusing on a point. This ensures an appropriate minimum camera offset. In general, this method is only recommended for points that are elevated above the terrain surface.

        NOTE: this is NOT a recommended focus distance.

        Parameters:
        location - The focus location
        localElevation - The local elevation at the point location
        vfov - The vertical FOV of the camera
        heightPx - The height of the display viewport, in pixels
        Returns:
        The maximum recommended GSD that should be associated when requesting the camera to focus on the specified point, when taking into consideration the local elevation.

      • getMaximumFocusResolution

        public static double getMaximumFocusResolution​(GeoPoint location)

      • getCurrentMagneticVariation

        public static double getCurrentMagneticVariation​(GeoPoint point)
        For a specific GeoPoint, derive the actual magnetic declination that should be used as double offset. Note: Prior to August 7, 2017 Android devices utilized WMM 2010. See the change id I36f26086b1e2f62f81974d81d90c9a9c315a3445 in the Google Android Source code Peng Xu in response to bug 31216311. https://android.googlesource.com/platform/frameworks/base/+/63bf36a2117ca0338d7d4fdd3c5612a9e6091c04

      • computeGridConvergence

        @Deprecated
@DeprecatedApi(since="4.7",
               forRemoval=true,
               removeAt="5.0")
public static double computeGridConvergence​(GeoPoint sPoint,
                                            GeoPoint ePoint)
        Deprecated.
        GeoCalculations.computeGridConvergence(IGeoPoint, IGeoPoint)
        Obtains the grid convergence used for a specific line of bearing.
        Parameters:
        sPoint - the starting point for the line of bearing.
        ePoint - the end point for the line of bearing.
        Returns:
        the grid deviation (grid convergence) for the provided line of bearing. The value is in angular degrees between [-180.0, 180.0)

      • computeGridConvergence

        @Deprecated
@DeprecatedApi(since="4.7",
               forRemoval=true,
               removeAt="5.0")
public static double computeGridConvergence​(GeoPoint sPoint,
                                            double angle,
                                            double distance)
        Deprecated.
        GeoCalculations.computeGridConvergence(IGeoPoint, double, double)
        Obtains the grid convergence used for a specific line of bearing.
        Parameters:
        sPoint - the starting point for the line of bearing.
        angle - the angle of the line of bearing.
        distance - the length of the line of bearing.
        Returns:
        the grid deviation (grid convergence) for the provided line of bearing. It is important to note that grid convergence cannot be acheived unless the line of bearing has some length. This will determine which grid line is used to converge against. The value is in angular degrees between [-180.0, 180.0)

@DeprecatedApi(since="4.7",

        Convert a bearing from Magnetic North to True North
        Parameters:
        point - GeoPoint for the location of the Compass.
        angle - Bearing in degrees (Magnetic North)
        Returns:
        Bearing in degrees (True North)

      • pointInsidePolygon

        public static boolean pointInsidePolygon​(GeoPoint point,
                                         GeoPoint[] polygon)
        Check if a GeoPoint resides within a polygon represented by a GeoPoint Array The polygon does not have to convex in order for this function to work, but the first and last GeoPoint must be equivalent
        Parameters:
        point - GeoPoint to be tested
        polygon - Array of GeoPoint that represents the polygon (does not have to be convex)
        Returns:
        point resides in polygon?

      • SetIcon

        public static android.graphics.Bitmap SetIcon​(android.content.Context context,
                                              android.widget.ImageView icon,
                                              java.lang.String iconUriStr,
                                              int color)
        Set the icon based on the iconUriStr, must be run on the ui thread since it directly manipulates the passed in ImageView Parses all the support uri formats

        This call will block until the bitmap has been loaded. Use setIcon(Context, ImageView, String, int) as a non-blocking variant.

        Parameters:
        context -
        icon - The ImageView to display the icon
        iconUriStr - The URI to load the icon from
        color - The color to be applied to the icon
        Returns:
        Bitmap if one was created

      • setIcon

        public static int setIcon​(android.content.Context context,
                          android.widget.ImageView icon,
                          java.lang.String iconUriStr,
                          int color)
        Set the icon based on the iconUriStr, must be run on the ui thread since it directly manipulates the passed in ImageView Parses all the support uri formats

        This call will return immediately. If the icon cannot be loaded immediately, ICON_LOADING will be returned. Otherwise one of ICON_LOADED or ICON_FAILED will be returned, if the icon was or was not successfully set.

        Parameters:
        context -
        icon - The ImageView to display the icon
        iconUriStr - The URI to load the icon from
        color - The color to be applied to the icon
        Returns:
        One of ICON_LOADED, ICON_LOADING or ICON_FAILED. If ICON_LOADING is returned, future calls to this method may be successful.

      • getIconBitmap

        public static android.graphics.Bitmap getIconBitmap​(MapItem item)
        Generate a bitmap for this map item's icon
        Parameters:
        item - Map item
        Returns:
        Icon bitmap

      • getUriPath

        public static java.lang.String getUriPath​(java.lang.String uriStr)
        Convert a uriStr into a path keeping legacy behavior. Does not account for the hostname being included in the path. We also do not support file uri with two slashes "used to access files in a remote system."
        Parameters:
        uriStr - the uri string { file, android, android.resource, base64 or no scheme at all}
        Returns:
        the path of the uriStr

      • registerBitmapDecoder

        public static void registerBitmapDecoder​(java.lang.String scheme,
                                         ATAKUtilities.BitmapDecoder uriBitmapDecoder)
        Register a bitmap decoder with the system that will be called when the uri scheme is encountered.
        Parameters:
        scheme - the uri scheme supported.
        uriBitmapDecoder - the decoder used to process the uri.

      • unregisterBitmapDecoder

        public static void unregisterBitmapDecoder​(java.lang.String scheme)
        Unregister the uriBitmapDecoder for a specified scheme.
        Parameters:
        scheme - the uri scheme for the bitmap decoder to remove.

        Returns:
        Icon bitmap the bitmap that can be recycled by the user at any time.

      • getNonDuplicateName

        public static java.lang.String getNonDuplicateName​(java.lang.String newName,
                                                   java.util.List<java.lang.String> names,
                                                   java.lang.String format)
        Given a list of names, find the next non-duplicate name based on newName
        Parameters:
        newName - New name - i.e. ItemName
        names - List of names - i.e. ItemName, ItemName (1), ItemName (2)
        format - Format where '#' is replaced by the dupe number - i.e. " (#)"
        Returns:
        New non-duplicate name - i.e. ItemName (3)

        Parameters:
        icon - the imageview used for the bitmap from the file.
        iconFile - the file containing the image.
        Returns:
        the bitmap if the file is loaded correctly.

      • getStartDirectory

        public static java.lang.String getStartDirectory​(android.content.Context sharedPrefContext)
        Returns the appropriate starting directory for file dialogs. If the "defaultDirectory" shared preference exists, it will use the value. Otherwise, the "lastDirectory" shared preference value will be used.
        Parameters:
        sharedPrefContext - The context of the shared preferences to use
        Returns:
        the "defaultDirectory" shared preference, if exists, it will use the value. Otherwise, the "lastDirectory" shared preference value will be used.

      • getElevation

        public static double getElevation​(double lat,
                                  double lon,
                                  GeoPointMetaData p)
        Returns the best possible resolution of data or the best possible DTED ignoring all other elevation sources based on the system preference.
        Parameters:
        lat - the latitude to pull the elevation from
        lon - the longitude to pull the elevation from
        p - If it is null if only the raw elevation is desired as meters HAE. Double.NaN is returned if no elevation is found.
